channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: How Trump’s speeches have changed. And, Israel threatens to ban aid agency in Gaza
item.description: Trump’s rally speeches have become increasingly erratic in the final days of his campaign. And, Israel has voted to ban the United Nations aid agency in Gaza.
item.content:encoded:
Trump’s rally speeches have become increasingly erratic in the final days of his campaign. And, Israel has voted to ban the United Nations aid agency in Gaza.

(Image credit: Michael M. Santiago)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: This DIY Halloween costume turns you into the world's scariest animal
item.description: Here's a costume that won't take a lot of fuss — and will earn you the title "world's scariest animal" this Halloween.
item.content:encoded:
Here's a costume that won't take a lot of fuss — and will earn you the title "world's scariest animal" this Halloween.

(Image credit: Ben de la Cruz/NPR)
item.dc:creator: Susan Brink

item.title: 'Dreamers' can get Obamacare this year, unless a court case stops them
item.description: A Biden administration rule allows people in the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals program to enroll in ACA health plans and qualify for subsidies. Nineteen states are seeking to block the rule.
item.content:encoded:
A Biden administration rule allows people in the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals program to enroll in ACA health plans and qualify for subsidies. Nineteen states are seeking to block the rule.

(Image credit: Jack Brook)
item.dc:creator: Julie Appleby

item.title: Colleges are key to Democrats' strategy to lose by less in rural Pennsylvania
item.description: In the rural, red parts of Pennsylvania, young Democratic organizers have a plan to lose by less to win the state for Vice President Harris. But former President Donald Trump's campaign isn't worried.
item.content:encoded:
In the rural, red parts of Pennsylvania, young Democratic organizers have a plan to lose by less to win the state for Vice President Harris. But former President Donald Trump's campaign isn't worried.

(Image credit: Elena Moore / NPR)
item.dc:creator: Elena Moore

item.title: Meet America's secret team of nuclear first responders
item.description: For 50 years, a secretive group of government workers has been preparing for the worst. Here's a rare look inside the team that's ready to respond to a nuclear incident anywhere, anytime.
item.content:encoded:
For 50 years, a secretive group of government workers has been preparing for the worst. Here's a rare look inside the team that's ready to respond to a nuclear incident anywhere, anytime.

(Image credit: NNSA)
item.dc:creator: Geoff Brumfiel

item.title: Harris called Trump a 'fascist.' Experts debate what fascism is -- and isn't
item.description: Vice President Harris and Trump's former chief of staff say Trump fits the definition of "fascist." Scholars who agree say the term is useful as a distress signal for the threat to democracy.
item.content:encoded:
Vice President Harris and Trump's former chief of staff say Trump fits the definition of "fascist." Scholars who agree say the term is useful as a distress signal for the threat to democracy.

(Image credit: Ted S. Warren)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: Harris returns to the site of Trump’s Jan. 6 rally to make her closing argument
item.description: A week before Election Day, Vice President Harris will use the backdrop to lay out the case for turning the page on the divisive and chaotic politics of her Republican opponent.
item.content:encoded:
A week before Election Day, Vice President Harris will use the backdrop to lay out the case for turning the page on the divisive and chaotic politics of her Republican opponent.

(Image credit: Carlos Osorio)
item.dc:creator: Tamara Keith

item.title: In a razor-thin race, Trump's complicated ties with Georgia's governor could matter
item.description: Trump fell out with Gov. Brian Kemp after 2020, when Kemp rebuffed his efforts to overturn Georgia’s election result. Their relationship could matter to some voters in a state Trump narrowly lost.
item.content:encoded:
Trump fell out with Gov. Brian Kemp after 2020, when Kemp rebuffed his efforts to overturn Georgia’s election result. Their relationship could matter to some voters in a state Trump narrowly lost.

(Image credit: Matthew Pearson)
item.dc:creator: Sam Gringlas

item.title: New polling finds Harris gaining with a group she has struggled with: Black men
item.description: A new NAACP survey offers a mixed picture for the vice president. She has gained ground among Black men since August, but about one in five say they are still backing former President Donald Trump.
item.content:encoded:
A new NAACP survey offers a mixed picture for the vice president. She has gained ground among Black men since August, but about one in five say they are still backing former President Donald Trump.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Asma Khalid

item.title: The true story of a famed librarian and the secret she guarded closely
item.description: The name Belle da Costa Greene might not ring a bell, but New York's renowned historic Morgan Library and Museum is trying to change that.
item.content:encoded:
The name Belle da Costa Greene might not ring a bell, but New York's renowned historic Morgan Library and Museum is trying to change that.

(Image credit: Library of Congress)
item.dc:creator: Jordan-Marie Smith
